intro: Mesosphaerum racemulosum, commonly known as the clustered globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its spherical, clustered growth habit and produces showy yellow flowers with prominent red stamens. Its leaves are palmately divided, and it thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. Mesosphaerum racemulosum is often found in rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
